snippet: The fading of inflation gives Chinese officials considerable latitude to stimulate the economy, releasing brakes applied to bank loans and real estate investments over the past two years.
abstract: Inflation in China slows sharply in May, as companies cut prices to cope with faltering demand; fading inflation gives Chinese officials considerable latitude to stimulate the economy, releasing brakes applied to bank loans, real estate investment and other sectors over the past two years when rising prices had seemed like a threat.
lead_paragraph: The fading of inflation gives Chinese officials considerable latitude to stimulate the economy, releasing brakes applied to bank loans and real estate investments over the past two years.

headline.main: Inflation Slows in China as the Economy Continues to Weaken
